externalDocs.description: Find out more about Razorpay API

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the details of all the orders you created.

parameters.name: authorized
parameters.description: Retrieves Orders for which payments have been authorized. Payment and order states differ.

parameters.name: receipt
parameters.description: Retrieves the orders that contain the provided value for receipt.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Timestamp (in Unix format) from when the orders should be fetched.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Timestamp (in Unix format) up till when orders are to be fetched.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of orders to be fetched. The default value is 10. The maximum value is 100.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of orders to be skipped. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: expand[]
parameters.description: Used to retrieve additional information about the payment.

400.description: Invalid input

get.description: Fetch an order by its unique ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the order

patch.description: Update an order's notes or other editable fields.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the order

400.description: Invalid input

get.description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve all payments corresponding to a specific order.
[See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/payments/fetch-payments-orders)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the order for which you want to fetch payment details.

parameters.name: expand[]
parameters.description: Use to expand the card or EMI details for each payment.

200.description: Successfully retrieved all payments for the order (with expanded card or EMI details if requested)

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters

401.description: Authentication failed - The API credentials are invalid

post.description: Use this endpoint to create or add a customer with basic details such as name and contact details.

400.description: Invalid input or contact number is less than 8 digits

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the details of all the customers. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/customers/fetch-all/)

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of customer records to be retrieved from the system. The default value is 10. The maximum value is 100. This can be used for pagination in combination with skip.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of customer records that must be skipped. The default value is 0. This can be used for pagination in combination with count.

400.description: Invalid API credentials or bad request

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve details of a customer with id. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/customers/fetch-with-id/)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier linked to the customer.

400.description: Invalid customer id or does not exist

put.description: Use this endpoint to edit the customer details such as name, email, and contact details. The combination of email and contact must be unique for every customer.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier linked to the customer.

400.description: Invalid input, contact number is less than 8 digits, or invalid customer id

post.description: Use this endpoint to change the payment status from authorized to captured. Attempting to capture a payment whose status is not authorized will produce an error. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/payments/capture/)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the payment to be captured.

400.description: Bad request

get.summary: Fetch a Payment With ID (with optional expanded card or EMI details)
get.description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve the details of a specific payment using its id. You can expand the card or EMI details by passing the query parameter `expand[]=card` or `expand[]=emi`.
[See docs for card](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/payments/fetch-payment-expanded-card)
[See docs for EMI](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/payments/fetch-payment-expanded-emi)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the payment to be retrieved.

parameters.name: expand[]
parameters.description: Use to expand the card or EMI details when the payment method is 'card' or 'emi'.

200.description: Successfully retrieved payment details (with expanded card or EMI details if requested)

400.description: Bad request - The payment_id provided is incorrect

401.description: Authentication failed - The API credentials are invalid

patch.description:
Use this endpoint to update the `notes` field for a particular payment. Only the `notes` field can be updated. You can add up to 15 key-value pairs, each value not exceeding 256 characters.
[See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/payments/update)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the payment for which the notes field should be updated.

notes.description: Contains user-defined fields, stored for reference purposes. Maximum 15 key-value pairs, 256 characters each.

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters or notes

get.summary: Fetch All Payments (with optional expanded card or EMI details)
get.description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve details of all the payments. By default, only the last 10 records are displayed. You can use the `count` and `skip` parameters to retrieve the specific number of records that you need. You can also expand card or EMI details using `expand[]=card` or `expand[]=emi`.
[See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/payments/fetch-all-payments)

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: UNIX timestamp, in seconds, from when payments are to be fetched.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: UNIX timestamp, in seconds, till when payments are to be fetched.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of payments to be fetched. Default is 10. Maximum is 100.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of records to be skipped while fetching the payments.

parameters.name: expand[]
parameters.description: Use to expand the card or EMI details for each payment.

200.description: Successfully retrieved all payments (with expanded card or EMI details if requested)

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters

get.summary: Fetch Card Details of a Payment
get.description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve the details of the card used to make a payment.
[See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/payments/fetch-card-details-payment)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the payment for which you want to retrieve card details.

200.description: Successfully retrieved card details for the payment

400.description: Bad request - The payment_id provided is incorrect or payment was not done using card

post.description: Use this endpoint to process refunds instantaneously to your customers. The instant refund is enabled by default for your account. You should set the refund speed to `optimum` when creating a refund request to ensure refunds are processed instantly. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/refunds/create-instant/)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the payment which needs to be refunded.

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters, payment already refunded, or refund amount issues

get.summary: Fetch Multiple Refunds for a Payment
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve multiple refunds for a payment. By default, only the last 10 refunds are returned. You can use count and skip query parameters to change that behaviour. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/refunds/fetch-multiple-refund-payment)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the payment for which refund has been requested.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: UNIX timestamp at which the refunds were created.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: UNIX timestamp till which the refunds were created.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of refunds to fetch for the payment. Maximum is 100.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of refunds to be skipped for the payment.

200.description: Successfully retrieved refunds for the payment

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters or payment id

get.summary: Fetch a Specific Refund for a Payment
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve details of a specific refund made for a payment. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/refunds/fetch-specific-refund-payment)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the payment for which the refund has been made.

parameters.name: refund_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the refund to be retrieved.

200.description: Successfully retrieved refund details for the payment

400.description: Bad request - Invalid payment id or refund id

post.description:
Use this endpoint to create a Payment Link using basic details such as amount, expiry date, reference id, description, customer details and so on.
[See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/payments/payment-links/create-standard/)

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters

401.description: Authentication failed - The API credentials are invalid

get.description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve the details of all Payment Links.
To get only UPI Payment Links, filter the response objects where `upi_link` is `true`.
[See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/payments/payment-links/fetch-all-upi)

parameters.name: payment_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the payment associated with the Payment Link.

parameters.name: reference_id
parameters.description: The unique reference number entered while creating the Payment Link.

200.description: List of Payment Links fetched successfully

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters

get.description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve the details of a Payment Link using its id.
[See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/payments/payment-links/fetch-id-standard/)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Payment Link.

400.description: Bad request - Invalid or missing id

patch.description:
Use this endpoint to edit the Standard Payment Link details such as the reference id, expiry date, enabling reminders and so on.
[See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/payments/payment-links/update-standard)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Payment Link.

400.description: Bad request - Invalid or missing id, or invalid input fields

post.summary: Send or Resend Payment Link Notification
post.description:
Use this endpoint to send or resend notifications to your customers via email or SMS.
[See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/payments/payment-links/resend/)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Payment Link.

parameters.name: medium
parameters.description: Medium through which the Payment Link must be resent. Possible values:- sms, email.

success.description: Indicates whether the notification was sent successfully.

400.description: Bad request - Invalid notification medium or id

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the refund using the id. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/refunds/fetch-with-id/)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the refund which is to be retrieved.

400.description: Bad request - Invalid refund id or refund not found

patch.description: Use this endpoint to update the notes field for a particular refund. Only the notes field can be updated. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/refunds/update/)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the refund to be updated.

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters or notes

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve details of all refunds. By default, only the last 10 refunds are returned. You can use count and skip query parameters to change that behaviour. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/refunds/fetch-all/)

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: UNIX timestamp at which the refunds were created.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: UNIX timestamp till which the refunds were created.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of refunds to fetch. Maximum is 100.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of refunds to be skipped.

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters

post.description: Use this endpoint to create a QR Code. You can share the short URL with customers to accept payments, print, and download it. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/qr-codes/create/)

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters or missing required fields

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve details of all QR Codes. By default, only the last 10 QR Codes are returned. You can use count and skip query parameters to change that behaviour. You can also filter QR Codes by customer_id. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/qr-codes/fetch-customer-id)

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the customer whose QR Codes are to be fetched.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: UNIX timestamp, in seconds, from when QR Codes are to be fetched.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: UNIX timestamp, in seconds, till when QR Codes are to be fetched.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of QR Codes to be fetched. Default is 10. Maximum is 100.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of records to be skipped while fetching the QR Codes.

parameters.name: payment_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the payment whose QR Codes are to be fetched.

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters

get.summary: Fetch QR Codes for a Payment ID
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the details of a QR Code by using a Payment Id. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/qr-codes/fetch-payment-id/)

parameters.name: payment_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the payment whose QR Codes are to be fetched.

200.description: Successfully retrieved QR Codes for the payment

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters or payment id

post.description: Use this endpoint to close a QR Code. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/qr-codes/close/)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the QR Code to be closed.

400.description: Bad request - Invalid QR Code id or already closed

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve details of all settlements. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/settlements/fetch-all/)

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: UNIX timestamp (in seconds) from when settlements are to be fetched.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: UNIX timestamp (in seconds) till when settlements are to be fetched.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of settlement records to be fetched. Default is 10. Possible value- 1 to 100.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of settlement records to be skipped. Default is 0.

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve details of a settlement with its id. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/settlements/fetch-with-id)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the settlement to be retrieved.

400.description: Bad request - Invalid settlement id or not found

get.description: Use this endpoint to return a list of all transactions such as payments, refunds, transfers and adjustments settled to your account on a particular day or month. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/settlements/fetch-recon)

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: The year the settlement was received in the YYYY format. For example, 2022.

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: The month the settlement was received in the MM format. For example, 06.

parameters.name: day
parameters.description: The date on which the settlement was received in the DD format. For example, 11.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Specifies the number of available settlements to be fetched. Possible values- 1 to 1000.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Specifies the number of available settlements to be skipped when fetching a count.

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters

post.description: Use this endpoint to create an Instant Settlement. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/settlements/instant/create/)

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters or amount

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the details of a particular Instant Settlement. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/settlements/instant/fetch-with-id/)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the instant settlement transaction. For example, setlod_FNj7g2YS5J67Rz.

400.description: Bad request - Invalid settlement id or not found

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the details of all the available payouts in the system. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/x/payouts/fetch-all/)

parameters.name: account_number
parameters.description: The account from which the payouts were done. For example, 7878780080316316.

parameters.name: contact_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the contact for which you want to fetch payouts.

parameters.name: fund_account_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the fund account for which you want to fetch payouts.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The mode for which payouts are to be fetched. You can use one of the following payout modes NEFT, RTGS, IMPS, UPI, card, amazonpay.

parameters.name: reference_id
parameters.description: The user-generated reference for which payouts are to be fetched. Maximum length is 40 characters.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The payout status. Possible payout states queued, pending, rejected, processing, processed, cancelled, reversed, failed.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Timestamp, in Unix, from when you want to fetch payouts.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Timestamp, in Unix, till when you want to fetch payouts.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of payouts to be fetched. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 100.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Numbers of payouts to be skipped. Default value is 0.

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the details of a particular payout in the system. [See docs](https://razorpay.com/docs/api/x/payouts/fetch-with-id)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This is the unique identifier linked to the payout. For example, pout_00000000000001.

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters

post.description: Use this endpoint to create a plan with frequency, interval, item details, and notes

400.description: Bad request

amount.description: Amount in the smallest currency unit (e.g., paise)

first_payment_min_amount.description: Minimum amount for the first partial payment

amount.description: The payment amount in currency subunits. For example, for an amount of 1.00 enter 100.

currency.description: The currency in which the payment is made.

international.description: Indicates whether the payment is done via an international card or a domestic one.

method.description: The payment method used for making the payment.

amount_refunded.description: The amount refunded in currency subunits.

refund_status.description: The refund status of the payment.

captured.description: Indicates if the payment is captured.

description.description: Description of the payment, if any.

card_id.description: The unique identifier of the card used by the customer to make the payment.

bank.description: The 4-character bank code which the customer's account is associated with.

wallet.description: The name of the wallet used by the customer to make the payment.

vpa.description: The customer's VPA (Virtual Payment Address) or UPI id used to make the payment.

email.description: Customer email address used for the payment.

contact.description: Customer contact number used for the payment.

error_description.description: Description of the error that occurred during payment.

error_step.description: The stage where the transaction failure occurred.

created_at.description: Timestamp, in UNIX format, on which the payment was created.

card.description: Details of the card used to make the payment. Present only if method is 'card' and expand[]=card is used.

emi.description: Details of the EMI plan used to make the payment. Present only if method is 'emi' and expand[]=emi is used.

name.description: Customer's name. Alphanumeric value with period (.), apostrophe ('), forward slash (/), at (@) and parentheses are allowed. The name must be between 3-50 characters in length.

contact.description: The customer's phone number. A maximum length of 15 characters including country code.

email.description: The customer's email address. A maximum length of 64 characters.

fail_existing.description: Possible values: false (fetches details of existing customer), true (default, throws error if customer exists).

name.description: Customer's name. Alphanumeric, with period (.), apostrophe ('), forward slash (/), at (@) and parentheses allowed. The name must be between 3-50 characters in length.

contact.description: The customer's phone number. A maximum length of 15 characters including country code.

email.description: The customer's email address. A maximum length of 64 characters.

gstin.description: GST number linked to the customer.

created_at.description: UNIX timestamp, when the customer was created.

name.description: Customer's name. Alphanumeric, with period (.), apostrophe ('), forward slash (/), at (@) and parentheses allowed. The name must be between 3-50 characters in length.

contact.description: The customer's phone number. A maximum length of 15 characters including country code.

email.description: The customer's email address. A maximum length of 64 characters.

entity.description: Indicates the type of entity. Always 'collection' for this response.

count.description: The number of customer records returned in this response.

currency.description: The currency in which the payment is made.

entity.description: Name of the entity. Here, it is card.

last4.description: Last four digits of the card.

international.description: Indicates if the card is international.

emi.description: Indicates if the card supports EMI.

issuer.description: The bank code of the EMI issuer.

rate.description: The interest rate (in basis points) for the EMI plan.

duration.description: The duration of the EMI plan in months.

amount.description: Amount to be paid using the Payment Link. Must be in the smallest unit of the currency.

currency.description: A three-letter ISO code for the currency in which you want to accept the payment.

accept_partial.description: Indicates whether customers can make partial payments using the Payment Link.Not allowed for UPI Payment Links.

first_min_partial_amount.description: Minimum amount, in currency subunits, that must be paid by the customer as the first partial payment. Must be passed along with accept_partial.

expire_by.description: Timestamp, in Unix, at which the Payment Link will expire.

reference_id.description: Reference number tagged to a Payment Link. Must be unique for each Payment Link. Max 40 characters.

description.description: A brief description of the Payment Link. Max 2048 characters.

notify.description: Defines who handles Payment Link notification.

reminder_enable.description: Used to send reminders for the Payment Link.

callback_url.description: If specified, adds a redirect URL to the Payment Link.

callback_method.description: If callback_url parameter is passed, callback_method must be passed with the value get.

upi_link.description: Must be set to true for creating a UPI Payment Link. If not passed or false, a Standard Payment Link will be created.

id.description: Unique identifier of the Payment Link.

amount.description: Amount to be paid using the Payment Link.

accept_partial.description: Indicates whether customers can make partial payments.

first_min_partial_amount.description: Minimum amount for the first partial payment.

expired_at.description: Timestamp at which the Payment Link expired.

cancelled_at.description: Timestamp at which the Payment Link was cancelled.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the Payment Link was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the Payment Link was updated.

reference_id.description: Reference number tagged to a Payment Link.

reminder_enable.description: Used to send reminders for the Payment Link.

payments.description: Payment details such as amount, payment id, Payment Link id and more. This array is populated only after a payment is made by the customer or if the payment fails. Until then, the value is null.

amount.description: The amount paid by the customer using the Payment Link.

created_at.description: Timestamp, in Unix, indicating when the payment was made.

method.description: The payment method used to make the payment.

payment_id.description: Unique identifier of the payment made against the Payment Link.

plink_id.description: Unique identifier of the Payment Link.

updated_at.description: Timestamp, in Unix, indicating when the payment was updated.

short_url.description: The unique short URL generated for the Payment Link.

status.description: Current state of the Payment Link.

user_id.description: Unique identifier for the user role through which the Payment Link was created.

source.description: Source of the Payment Link creation (if applicable).

accept_partial.description: Indicates whether customers can make partial payments. Not allowed for UPI Payment Links.

reference_id.description: Adds a unique reference number to an existing link.

expire_by.description: Unix timestamp when the payment link should expire.

amount.description: The amount to be refunded. Amount should be in the smallest unit of the currency in which the payment was made. Required in case of partial refund.

speed.description: Indicates that the refund will be processed at an optimal speed based on Razorpay's internal fund transfer logic. Must be 'optimum'.

receipt.description: A unique identifier provided by you for your internal reference.

id.description: The unique identifier of the refund.

entity.description: Indicates the type of entity. Here, it is refund.

amount.description: The amount to be refunded (in the smallest unit of currency).

currency.description: The currency of payment amount for which the refund is initiated.

payment_id.description: The unique identifier of the payment for which a refund is initiated.

receipt.description: A unique identifier provided by you for your internal reference.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp at which the refund was created.

batch_id.description: This parameter is populated if the refund was created as part of a batch upload.

status.description: Indicates the state of the refund.

speed_processed.description: The mode used to process a refund.

speed_requested.description: The processing mode of the refund seen in the refund response.

type.description: The type of the QR Code. Only 'upi_qr' is supported.

name.description: Label entered to identify the QR Code.

usage.description: Indicates if the QR Code should accept single or multiple payments.

fixed_amount.description: Indicates if the QR should accept payments of specific amounts or any amount.

payment_amount.description: The amount allowed for a transaction (in the smallest currency unit).

description.description: A brief description about the QR Code.

customer_id.description: The unique identifier of the customer the QR Code is linked with.

close_by.description: Unix timestamp at which the QR Code is scheduled to be automatically closed.

id.description: The unique identifier of the QR Code.

entity.description: Indicates the type of entity. Here, it is qr_code.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp at which the QR Code is created.

name.description: Label entered to identify the QR Code.

usage.description: Indicates if the QR Code should accept single or multiple payments.

type.description: The type of the QR Code. Only 'upi_qr' is supported.

image_url.description: The URL of the QR Code image.

payment_amount.description: The amount allowed for a transaction (in the smallest currency unit).

status.description: Indicates the status of the QR Code.

description.description: A brief description about the QR Code.

fixed_amount.description: Indicates if the QR Code should accept payments of specific amounts or any amount.

payments_amount_received.description: The total amount received on the QR Code.

payments_count_received.description: The total number of payments received on the QR Code.

customer_id.description: The unique identifier of the customer the QR Code is linked with.

close_by.description: Unix timestamp at which the QR Code is scheduled to be automatically closed.

closed_at.description: Unix timestamp at which the QR Code is automatically closed.

close_reason.description: The reason for the closure of the QR Code.

items.description: Tax invoice details for GST compliant transactions

number.description: This is the invoice number against which the payment is collected. If not provided, the transaction will default to non-GST compliant UPI flow.

date.description: Unix Timestamp that indicates the issue date of the invoice. If not provided, it will default to the current date.

customer_name.description: Customer name on the invoice. If not provided, the transaction will default to non-GST compliant UPI flow.

business_gstin.description: The GSTIN mentioned on the invoice. If not passed, it is picked up from the database.

gst_amount.description: GST amount on the invoice in paise. If not provided, the transaction will default to the non-GST compliant UPI flow.

cess_amount.description: CESS Amount on the invoice in paise. If not provided, the transaction will default to the non-GST compliant UPI flow.

supply_type.description: Indicates whether the transaction is interstate or intrastate

id.description: The unique identifier of the settlement transaction.

entity.description: Indicates the type of entity. Here, it is settlement.

amount.description: The amount to be settled (in the smallest unit of currency).

fees.description: The total fee charged for processing all payments received from customers settled to you in this settlement transaction.

tax.description: The total tax, in currency subunits, charged on the fees collected to process all payments received from customers settled to you in this settlement transaction.

utr.description: The Unique Transaction Reference (UTR) number available across banks.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp at which the settlement transaction was created.

entity_id.description: The unique identifier of the transaction that has been settled.

debit.description: The amount, in currency subunits, that has been debited from your account for this transaction.

credit.description: The amount, in currency subunits, that has been credited to your account for this transaction.

amount.description: The total amount of the transaction (in the smallest unit of currency).

fee.description: The fee charged for processing the transaction.

tax.description: The tax charged for processing the transaction.

on_hold.description: Indicates whether the account settlement for transfer is on hold.

settled.description: Indicates whether the transaction has been settled or not.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp at which the transaction was created.

settled_at.description: Unix timestamp when the transaction was settled.

settlement_id.description: The unique identifier of the settlement transaction.

posted_at.description: Unix timestamp when the transaction was posted.

credit_type.description: The type of credit for the transaction.

payment_id.description: The unique identifier of the payment linked to refund or transfer that has been settled.

settlement_utr.description: The unique reference number linked to the settlement.

order_id.description: Order id linked to the payment made by the customer that has been settled.

order_receipt.description: Receipt number entered while creating the Order.

method.description: The payment method used to complete the payment.

card_network.description: The card network used to process the payment.

card_issuer.description: The 4-character code denoting the issuing bank.

card_type.description: The card type used to process the payment.

dispute_id.description: The unique identifier of any dispute, if any, for this transaction.

count.description: Number of settlement recon records returned.

amount.description: The amount, in paise, you want to get settled instantly.

settle_full_balance.description: Indicates whether full balance is settled. If true, Razorpay will settle the maximum amount possible and ignore the amount parameter.

description.description: Custom note for the instant settlement. Max 30 characters. Allowed a-z, A-Z, 0-9, space.
description.example: Need this to make vendor payments.

id.description: The unique identifier of the instant settlement transaction.

entity.description: Indicates the type of entity. Here it is settlement.ondemand.

amount_requested.description: The settlement amount, in paise, requested by you.

amount_settled.description: Total amount (minus fees and tax), in paise, settled to the bank account.

amount_pending.description: Portion of the requested amount, in paise, yet to be settled to you.

amount_reversed.description: Portion of the requested amount, in paise, that was not settled to you. This amount is reversed to your PG current balance.

fees.description: Total amount (fees+tax), in paise, deducted for the instant settlement.

tax.description: Total tax, in paise, charged for the fee component.

currency.description: The 3-letter ISO currency code for the settlement.

settle_full_balance.description: Indicates whether full balance is settled.

status.description: Indicates the state of the instant settlement.

description.description: Custom note for the instant settlement.
description.example: Need this to make vendor payments.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp at which the instant settlement was created.

ondemand_payouts.description: List of payouts created for the instant settlement.

id.description: The unique identifier of the payout.

entity.description: The entity being created. Here, it will be payout.

fund_account_id.description: The unique identifier linked to the fund account.

amount.description: The payout amount, in paise. The value does not include fees and tax. Fees and tax, if any, are deducted from your account balance.

currency.description: The payout's currency. Here, it is INR.

fees.description: The fees for the payout. This value is returned only when the payout moves to the processing state.

tax.description: The tax that is applicable for the fee being charged. This value is returned only when the payout moves to the processing state.

purpose.description: The purpose of the payout that is being created.

utr.description: The unique transaction number linked to a payout.

mode.description: The mode used to make the payout.

reference_id.description: A user-generated reference given to the payout. Maximum length is 40 characters.

narration.description: Custom note that also appears on the bank statement. Maximum length 30 characters.

batch_id.description: This value is returned if the contact was created as part of a bulk upload.

status_details.description: This parameter returns the current status of the payout.

description.example: Payout is processed and the money has been credited into the beneficiaries account

created_at.description: Indicates the Unix timestamp when this payout was created.

fee_type.description: Indicates the fee type charged for the payout. Possible value is free_payout.

entity.description: Name of the entity. Always collection.

oneOf.description: Key-value pair that can be used to store additional information about the entity.
Key-value pair for additional information as an array

AcquirerData.description: A dynamic array consisting of unique reference numbers.

period.description: This, combined with interval, defines the frequency of the plan. Possible values are daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, yearly

interval.description: This, combined with period, defines the frequency of the plan. If the billing cycle is 2 months, the value should be 2. For daily plans, the minimum value should be 7

id.description: The unique identifier linked to a plan

entity.description: The entity being created. Here, it is plan

interval.description: Used together with period to define how often the customer should be charged

period.description: Used together with interval to define how often the customer should be charged. Possible values are daily, weekly, monthly, yearly

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp at which the plan was created

active.description: Indicates if the item is active

description.example: Description for the test plan - Weekly

amount.description: Amount for the plan item in currency subunits

unit_amount.description: Unit amount for the plan item in currency subunits

tax_group_id.description: Tax group ID for the item

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp at which the item was created

updated_at.description: The Unix timestamp at which the item was last updated
